item.title: [HBASE-14529] Respond to SIGHUP to reload config
item.description:
SIGHUP is the way everyone since the dawn of unix has done config reload.
Lets not be a special unique snowflake.

Patch looks good except for the s/nohup/disown/ That incompat change? disown == nohup?

Disown is pretty close to nohup for our purposes.

nohup will mask out getting the SIGHUP signal. So java won't ever get the SIGHUP signal. We're doing that so that when someone closes a login shell things aren't killed.
diswon does something different. It changes who the parent process is to 1 (init). That means that when someone closes their shell the java process continues. However it doesn't filter out the hup signal. So java can still get that sent.

For the user it should be seamless. They shouldn't see any difference other pstree will have the java hanging off of init even before the users closes their shell.
Ok on 2.0 then with fat release note. Where else should it go? 1.3. Want this for 1.2 Sean Busbey?

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
HBase daemons can now be signaled to reload their config by sending SIGHUP to the java process. Not all config parameters can be reloaded.

In order for this new feature to work the hbase-daemon.sh script was changed to use disown rather than nohup. Functionally this shouldn't change anything but the processes will have a different parent when being run from a connected login shell.
